main event: On July 7, 1947, in East Troy, Wisconsin, a silver object was observed moving vertically through the clouds. It stopped at 1000 feet, assumed a horizontal position, proceeded in horizontal flight covering 25 miles in 15 seconds, and then disappeared.
interesting points: The object moved vertically through the clouds and then assumed a horizontal position, demonstrating unusual flight capabilities.
It covered a distance of 25 miles in just 15 seconds, indicating high-speed movement.
The source of the observation was both military and civilian, lending credibility to the sighting.
The observation lasted for 1-20 seconds, providing a brief but intense window for the witnesses.
The report indicates the possibility of the object being an aircraft, aerolith, or unknown phenomenon, leaving the nature of the object open to interpretation.
sighted object: A silver object with irregular flight
